result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Montes De Oca was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Antonio Montes De Oca is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Antonio Montes De Oca was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Do not reside with any person of the opposite sex, unless you are related to them by blood.  May Not have contact with victim other than allowed by the Domestic Relations Court.  DOC shall promptly notify the court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made againsst the deft.

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed.  It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the Sheriff under the Statutes.
AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION court imposes 227 days KCJ.  Huber privileges are allowed for work purposes only; directly to and from work only.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  CONSECUTIVE to any previously pronounced sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Do not reside with any person of the opposite sex, unless related by blood.  May not have contact with Victim other than allowed by the Domestic Relations Court.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the Deft.
Bond previously applied - costs pd in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Montes De Oca

records.addlTxt: Court reporter transcript invoice for 112117 sentencing paid by county $34.00.
11/21/17 - Sentencing Hearing on Revocation

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Christopher Rose.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 1yr WSP followed by 1yr of ES.  This sentence shall be consecutive to any previously pronounced sentence.  ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  Credit for 393 days.  Appeal rights.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Ben Schwarz.  Agent Charles Sosinki present.  Defense moves to exclude the deft's statement from the packet of paperwork.  Arguments heard.  Court does not agree with the interpretation of the law as presented by defense counsel, but the Court will not consider the deft's statement for purposes of today's hrg.  All parties concur with the Dept's request for 90 days of KCJ.  Deft sentenced to 227 days KCJ as a condition of probation due to violations.  Huber allowed for work purposes only; directly to/from work only.
Benjamin Schwarz  kmk
email requesting court review for violation.
Andrea Rufo  kmk

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Atty Andrea Rufo appeared on behalf of Atty Carmen Ayres.  Deft not transported from the KCJ.  Victim present; statement made.  Defense brought a motion for deft's release for the birth of his twins.  State objects to the motion for release.  Brief discussion held.  Court will grant the motion; but just for the birth of the twins - not for any additional days.  Deft will need to return to the jail following the birth of the twins.  Defense counsel to prepare an order; submit to ADA for approval prior to submitting to court for approval.
for Release from Custody
Bond applied; partial refund.  gb/cp  ck# 15CH075311
For Ct 2 only -Dismissed.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  15CM328 & 15CM571.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Carmen Ayres.  Cases are resolved.

15CM328 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 2yrs.  See conditions.  Deft is given 4mos KCJ as a condition of probation commencing 11/28/15.  Huber is allowed.  It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the Sheriff under the Statutes.  Count 2 is dismissed on State's motion.  Bond shall be applied towards financial obligations.  Balance may be returned to poster.  Request for expunction is denied.

15CM571 - case dismissed on State's motion.  Bond may be returned to poster.

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN.  15CM328/15CM571.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person with Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Defense reports the case is settled.  Due to ongoing jury trial, plea hrg set for 11/16/15 @ 11:15am
Date of FPT changed to 10/28/15 @ 9:10am to be heard in conjunction w/15CM571 in lieu of 10/25/15 which was a Sunday
